data.title: Philip Habsburg (1478-1506)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Philip I Habsburg born 1478 Bruges, West-Vlaanderen, Belgium died 1506 Burgos, Burgos, Castilla y León, Spain including ancestors + descendants + 4 photos + 4 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Philip (Philip I) "King of Spain, the Fair, Felipe El Hermoso" Habsburg

Born 22 Jul 1478 in Bruges, West-Vlaanderen, Belgium

Ancestors

Husband of Joanna Trastamara — married 21 Aug 1496 (to 25 Sep 1506) in Lierre, Anvers, Belgium

Descendants

Died 25 Sep 1506 at age 28 in Burgos, Burgos, Castilla y León, Spain

Profile last modified 7 Jul 2024 | Created 12 Sep 2010

This page has been accessed 8,061 times.

Philip I Habsburg was a member of the aristocracy in Europe.

Biography

Philipp I. von Habsburg (* 22. Juli 1478 in Brügge; † 25. September 1506 in Burgos) was also known as Felipe I de Castilla «el Hermoso».

In 1482 he became Archduke of Burgundy, after his mother's death. He was also King of Castile and Léon from 26 November 1504 to his death.

He married Joanna of Castile in 21 October 1496 and the couple had six children:

Eleanor (1498–1558), queen consort of Portugal and France

Charles (1500–1558), king of Spain, emperor of the Holy Roman Empire

Isabella (1501–1526), queen consort of Denmark, Norway and Sweden

Ferdinand I (1503–1564), king of Bohemia and Hungary, emperor of the Holy Roman Empire

Mary (1505–1558), queen consort of Hungary and Bohemia

Catherine (1507–1578), queen consort of Portugal

Sources

Wikipedia: Philip I of Castile.

FMG: Aragon Kings.

Thomas, Joseph: The Universal Dictionary of Biography and Mythology, p. 1785.

This week's featured connections are Redheads: Philip I is 2 degrees from Catherine of Aragón, 20 degrees from Clara Bow, 27 degrees from Julia Gillard, 15 degrees from Nancy Hart, 18 degrees from Rutherford Hayes, 16 degrees from Rita Hayworth, 21 degrees from Leonard Kelly, 15 degrees from Rose Leslie, 18 degrees from Damian Lewis, 21 degrees from Maureen O'Hara, 25 degrees from Jopie Schaft and 23 degrees from Eirik Thorvaldsson on our single family tree.
